TopicTitle: Grinding away at Visual Survey Contracts

Articles.Content:
So KSP is fun, right? Especially since the newest update.

So I tried to get some funds for my Mun project, and I resorted to do some visual survey contracts.

That turned out to be surprisingly hard with low tech.

Here is my pain:

Rockets are more important to Kerbals I think *shifty eyes* lol. These new missions are killing me! Well, killing the Kerbals. Hahahahahaha.
I did something similar for my 0.90 career. Building stuff with low tech levels is a bunch of fun.

shameless plug:

more info

A rocket-like ascent to 10km, then gliding will cover the small circle; getting as far as the large circle is considerably more effort. Beyond that, I recommend waiting for jets.

What works great as a low-tech takeoff-aid are seperatrons. Just fire up your jet, trigger ~ 4 seperatrons to lift your small plane up and off you go. Landing via chutes. Worked great for me until unlocking landing gear.

You'd think that Kerbals would have invented the wheel before rockets, but apparently it's not the case.

They did. They're called fuel tanks.

They did. They're called fuel tanks.

I think the did have wheels before rockets, they just didn't think to combine the two, so the space program doesn't get them until later.

I like the idea of survey contracts, but I have yet to attempt one.

I see that Katamari vessels are commonplace to explore the KSC.

Good, good.

Well, the brits solved this pickle for me years ago, so I blatantly copied EVERYTHING.

Exactly 30 parts for 6,3 tons of weight.

Switching from VTOL to normal mode isn't easy, since action group are still disabled. But once you get the hang of it, it's pure fun.

Its maximum flying altitude it's around 20.000 meters if I remember correctly (I was too busy practicing landings to remember).

I landed on the top of a mountain to get some science, then I tried to see if they added a biome on the old airstrip, one last stop on the VAB, and returned it safely on the runway.

NOTE: No-one told me that the helipad on the L1 VAB are ridiculously small and aren't flat with the roof, so I had to close the front legs to level the craft.

I just dropped on them from orbit

I decided to make a pod bomber to get the surface data. It worked well once. I made low speed passes and dropped the command pod with deployed chutes.

I had some weird results though. As far as I could tell, if I was out of rendering range the pod would be destroyed. I'm guessing it goes on rails and that doesn't bode well for something that will hit the surface regardless of the speed. I did stay in rendering range once though and it worked.

I made a tailsitter jet for the exploration contracts before I had landing gear. I found out that landing vertically with a jet is very difficult due to the throttle lag.

Wow... All these designs with wings and stuff... For the survey missions I completed all I did was build a basic rocket, launched it and pointed it in the direction of the survey location. When I had a ballistic trajectory that would take me over the survey location at an appropriate altitude I just let her coast and made a crew report when the icon on the navball started flashing. Once I had the report I popped the chute and returned to the surface etc.

Sorry for such a stupid question, but I was looking at Visual Surveys for the first time today. I didn't bother to accept any of them because I have no idea how to know where the given locations are, how do you find this out?
Go to the Tracking Station or the Map mode (M key while in flight). The locations are even visible before you accept the contract.
